page.title: 04Assynt Sheepdog Trials
page.content: Sheep dog trials are held at{Kirkton park on the{first Saturday in June at {8.00am.}On the previous evening the {local trial}is held. There are three different trials, local, open and the {County of Sutherland}competition which is held with the open. A shield and Â£8 is the local prize, a cup and Â£10 is the prize for the County of Sutherland and Â£30 and a cup is the prize for the open. The 4 fresh sheep start off at a starting point and are driven through 2 gates towards the shepherd, then behind & away from him through 2 more sets of gates before being driven into the pen and shedded. This all has to be done within 11mins. Over 100 people come to watch. A licensed tent and snacks are available to the public. There are special prizes in the local which are: best penning, best run out, youngest competitor and most noise!
